definition.name: NXstm
definition.doc: Application definition for scanning tunneling microscopy (STM).

group.doc:
This group contains all the data and associated information that comprise a single measurement.
A single measurement can be defined as all and only the data acquired in a defined time period, which are linked to each other, and is the minimum dataset to represent a meaningful measurement.
Examples of single measurements for STM include but are not limited to:
* Topography and current channels, both forward and backward scans if present, which were acquired simultaneously. For each of these (4) channels an NXdata group will be present in this NXentry.
* Spectra taken at points along a single line, possibly multiple times for each point. For each of these spectra an NXdata group will be present in this NXentry.

field.name: title
field.doc: Brief description of the measurement (required).

field.name: start_time
field.doc: Date and time of measurement start. In ISO8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss+UTC_offset (e.g. 2019-02-25T10:17:54+01:00). (required)

field.name: duration
field.doc: Duration of the measurement. In ISO8601 format.

field.name: definition
field.doc:
NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms. (required)
Here set as "NXstm".

group.doc:
Description of the instrument setup during measurement.
In case some specific dataset of the measurement has a different setup, the fields can be replicated in the correspondent NXdata group.

field.name: name
field.doc:
Name of the instrument. (required)
Here set as "Scanning tunneling microscope".

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.doc:
Acronym for the instrument.
Here set as "STM".

field.name: current_setpoint
field.doc: Setpoint for the tunneling current when feedback loop is active [amperes]. (required)

field.name: bias
field.doc:
Bias applied to the sample during data acquisition [volts]. (required)
Usually this is the same as "bias_setpoint", but it could differ e.g. in constant height measurements with feedback loop not active.

field.name: bias_setpoint
field.doc:
Bias applied to the sample when feedback loop is active [volts]. (required)
Usually this is the same as "bias", but it could differ e.g. in constant height measurements with feedback loop not active.

field.name: feedback_active
field.doc:
Whether the feedback loop is close/active (True) or open/not active (False) during data acquisition. (required)
Allowed values:
* True (closed loop, constant current mode) * False (open loop, constant height mode)

field.name: feedback_type
field.doc:
Type of feedback loop.
Allowed values:
* linear * logarithmic

field.name: feedback_pgain
field.doc: Proportional gain of the feedback loop [meters].

field.name: feedback_igain
field.doc: Integral gain of the feedback loop [meters/second].

field.name: preamp_gain
field.doc: Current amplification factor of the preamplifier I-V converter [volts/ampere].

field.name: preamp_cutoff_frequency
field.doc: Cutoff frequency of the preamplifier [hertz].

field.name: z_offset
field.doc:
Additional Z offset with respect to setpoint position [meters].
Applicable if feedback_active=False (constant height mode). It is positive if tip is retracted from the sample and negative if it is approached toward the sample.

field.name: time_per_point
field.doc: Acquisition time for each point value in data [seconds]. (required)

field.name: scan_angle
field.doc: Rotation angle of the scan [degrees]. (required)

field.name: scan_offset_x
field.doc:
Absolute offset along the x axis of the center of the image with respect to the scan area center [meters].
Point spectra y positions relative to this offset (i.e. relative to the image center) are specified into a data variable.

field.name: scan_offset_y
field.doc:
Absolute offset along the y axis of the center of the image with respect to the scan area center [meters].
Point spectra y positions relative to this offset (i.e. relative to the image center) are specified into a data variable.

field.name: scan_slope_x
field.doc: Surface slope compensation along x axis [degrees].

field.name: scan_slope_y
field.doc: Surface slope compensation along y axis [degrees].

field.name: drift_vector_x
field.doc: Drift speed vector along x direction [meters/second].

field.name: drift_vector_y
field.doc: Drift speed vector along y direction [meters/second].

field.name: drift_vector_z
field.doc: Drift speed vector along z direction [meters/second].

field.name: piezo_sensitivity_x
field.doc: Piezo sensitivity along the x scan direction [meters/volt].

field.name: piezo_sensitivity_y
field.doc: Piezo sensitivity along the y scan direction [meters/volt].

field.name: piezo_sensitivity_z
field.doc: Piezo sensitivity along the z scan direction [meters/volt].

field.name: bias_mod_amplitude
field.doc: Bias amplitude modulation for spectroscopy measurements with lock-in technique [volts].

field.name: bias_mod_frequency
field.doc: Bias frequency modulation for spectroscopy measurements with lock-in technique [hertz].

field.name: z_mod_amplitude
field.doc: Amplitude modulation on z direction for spectroscopy measurements with lock-in technique [meters].

field.name: z_mod_frequency
field.doc: Frequency modulation on z direction for spectroscopy measurements with lock-in technique [hertz].

field.name: name
field.doc: Descriptive name of the sample. (required)

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Temperature of the sample during data acquisition [kelvin]. (required)

attribute.name: signal
attribute.doc:
Declares which dataset is the default. (required)
The value is the name of the dataset to be plotted. A field of this name *must* exist (either as dataset or as a link to a dataset).

attribute.name: axes
attribute.doc:
String array that defines the independent data fields or coordinates. (required)
Used in the default plot for all of the dimensions of the *signal* field (the *signal* field is the field in this group that is named by the ``signal`` attribute of this group). One entry is provided for every dimension in the *signal* field.

attribute.name: AXISNAME_indices
attribute.doc: Each ``AXISNAME_indices`` attribute indicates the dependency relationship of the ``AXISNAME`` field (where ``AXISNAME`` is the name of a field that exists in this ``NXdata`` group) with one or more dimensions of the plottable data. (required)

field.name: DATA
field.doc: This field contains the data values to be used as the NeXus plottable data.

attribute.name: units
attribute.doc: Units for the values in data. (required)

attribute.name: interpretation
attribute.doc:
Describes how to display the data. (required)
Allowed values are:
* scalar (0-D data) * spectrum (1-D data) * image (2-D data) * vertex (3-D data)

field.name: VARIABLE
field.doc:
Coordinates array along an axis of the data.
For each data dimension exists one of this fields.

field.name: scaling_factor
field.doc:
Data scaling factor. It is required to get the data physical values.
If not applicable it equals to 1.

field.name: offset
field.doc:
An offset to apply to the data to get the physical values.
It has to match the units of the data values. If not applicable it equals to 0.

field.name: points_x
field.doc: Number of points acquired along the x axis.

field.name: points_y
field.doc:
Number of points acquired along the y axis.
Applies only to image or vertex data.

field.name: points_z
field.doc:
Number of points acquired along the z axis.
Applies only to vertex data.

field.name: size_x
field.doc:
Lateral size of the scanned image along the x axis. (required)
It has to match the units of the relative axis coordinate [meters]. Applies only to image or vertex data.

field.name: size_y
field.doc:
Lateral size of the scanned image along the y axis. (required)
It has to match the units of the relative axis coordinate [meters]. Applies only to image or vertex data.

field.name: scan_direction_x
field.doc:
Scan direction along x axis.
Applies only to image or vertex data. Allowed values are:
* positive * negative

field.name: scan_direction_y
field.doc:
Scan direction along y axis.
Applies only to image or vertex data. Allowed values are:
* positive * negative
